text: The Royal Palace of El Pardo (, ) is one of the official residences of the Spanish royal family and one of the oldest, being used by the Spanish monarchs since Henry III of Castile in the 15th century. The palace began as a royal hunting lodge on the hill of El Pardo."El Pardo Royal Palace", Instituto de Turismo de Espa√±a It became another residence of the kings of Spain until the reign of King Alfonso XII of Spain."Death of the King of Spain", The Times (26 November 1885): 7. ==References== Category:Palaces in Spain Category:Buildings and structures in Madrid
